titleStmt.title: To the Kings most excellent Majesty.
titleStmt.author: Lluelyn, Martin, 1616-1682.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for J. Martin, Ja. Allestry, T. Dicas, and are to be sold at the Bell in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: By Martin Lluelyn, who signs each poem.
Verses written to the King and his brothers the Duke of York and the Duke of Gloucester.
In this edition "s" of "Kings" in second line of title is upside-down; p. 3 line 6 of text ends: bewaile, or welcome thee.
Variant; Thomason Tract copy lacks colophon.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Bell in St. Pauls Church-yard
